text: I first encountered Judith Nelson and I
believe was may of 2002 I signed up to
this dating site and I came across a
profile that mentioned chamber music and
classical music I was just getting ready
to go away on tour so we met once and
then she went away she left she won't
lift one out of my life to work and he
had said that he would email me well I
was on tour how you gonna write somebody
like you really like you can't say well
it's really serious stuff so I'd write
to her in doggerel like really bad
rhymes and verses and hang seng to come
home every night for my concert and find
an email a funny email with you know
these poems and comments and so on was
just great it was a real Katina that
pasta to goes just so I wrote her a lot
of that stuff trying to the best way to
listen to see if you'd laugh and maybe
answer back and she answered back and oh
she writes very bad poetry to you know
which is which was great once I got back
from tour I moved back into my apartment
after a nine-month absence for this huge
renovation and the apartment was a
complete disaster she came back and
hadn't seen each other for a while I met
her at avery fisher hall after a
rehearsal and I finally asked him if he
would come over and maybe help me with
my apartment a little bit he came in and
it was an absolute disaster and i saw
this kind of look of fear in her eyes
and knowing that what she really wanted
was a little bit of help so our dates
for a while for several maybe a couple
of months where he would come over and
we would cook dinner then we would sand
the paneling and paint then we watch a
movie she was grateful I think and she
loved to see her apartment come to get
and I was so grateful to have like
really cheap dates you know that I just
the longer I knew him the more I enjoyed
him start to see past his sanding
abilities which were you know of course
amazing we would try and work out and
have our day together during the week
yeah we finally decided that he should
move in but you know getting to people's
books music all his paintings you know
it's been challenging judy has been a
single strong single woman all her life
no she said relationships but she never
married he's been kind of interested in
getting married for I think quite a
while I've been a little slower too I've
kind of been like well things are going
fine why do we need to get married Lee
on the other hand I've got five sisters
I was married I've been surrounded by
women all my life you know and I kind of
liked that living with somebody and the
matrimonial state I fit into it quite
naturally then when he moved in a year
ago it sort of came a little bit more to
the fore she knew something up was up
because I she could see this like
bulging box in my sport coat and what so
he knew something was up we ordered
dinner afterwards I was trying to think
of the words to use and said here you
know
will you marry me and she said yes very
much and that was that
